EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be done by providing an official score report from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 61 on the internet-based test (IBT). International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 44. Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90. Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112.

Students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met in one of the following ways: TOEFL – minimum score of 61 on the iBT or 500 on the paper-based test; IELTS – minimum score of 6.0; Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 95; Pearson PTE Academic - minimum score of 45; ELS Language Center – completion of Level 109.

Students from non-English speaking countries are required to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met with one of the following: TOEFL – a minimum score of 61 on the iBT (internet based) or 500 on the pBT (paper based); IELTS – an overall band score of 6.0 or higher; Duolingo – a minimum score of 90; ELS – successful completion of Level 109; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic – a minimum score of 44.

Applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 61 on the internet-based test (iBT), or 500 on the paper-based test (PBT). International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5. Successful completion of the ELS Language Centers Level 109. Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL – minimum score of 61 on the iBT or 500 on the paper-based test, IELTS – minimum score of 6.0, PTE – minimum score of 44, Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 90, or Completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112.

Students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. Students may meet this requirement by providing an official score report from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) – A minimum score of 61 on the internet-based test (iBT), 173 on the computer-based test, or 500 on the paper-based test. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) – A minimum score of 6.0. Duolingo – A minimum score of 95. Pearson Test of English (PTE) – A minimum score of 50.

Proof of English proficiency if English is not the applicant’s native language. TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) – 61 minimum score on the IBT (internet-based test) and 500 on the PBT (paper-based test); IELTS (International English Language Testing System) – 6.0 minimum score; PTE (Pearson Test of English Academic) – 44 minimum score; Duolingo English Test – 90 minimum score; Completion of ELS (English Language Services) Level 112.

An official TOEFL, IELTS, ELS, or Duolingo score report is required for all students whose native language is not English. TOEFL-IBT score of 61 or higher; IELTS score of 6.0 or higher; Duolingo score of 95 or higher; ELS Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA. If a student has a minimum 3.0 GPA at another U.S. college or university and has completed 24 or more transferable credit hours, which must include English 101 and English 102 with a C or better in both courses, the language proficiency requirement may be waived.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following official test scores: TOEFL – 61 iBT (internet-based test) or 500 PBT (paper-based test), IELTS – 6.0, Duolingo – 90, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic – 45, or ELS Language Center – Completion of Level 112.

International graduate students must provide proof of English language proficiency by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test or 61 on the internet-based test; International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.0; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 44; Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112; or other waiver criteria.

If your native language is not English, you will need to submit one of the following as proof of English proficiency:
- TOEFL with a minimum score of 61 on the iBT or 500 on the paper-based test
- IELTS with a minimum score of 5.5
- Duolingo with a minimum score of 90
- ELS Language Center completion of Level 109
- STEP Eiken with a minimum score of Pre-1
Students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English proficiency. Students may submit scores from TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or Pearson PTE.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL – Test of English as a Foreign Language – with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test, 173 on the computer-based test, or 61 on the Internet-based test. IELTS – International English Language Testing System – with a minimum score of 5.5. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112. Duolingo score of 90.

Students who are not from a TOEFL exempt country must provide evidence of English proficiency. Midway University requires a minimum score of 61 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT, a 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or a 90 on the Duolingo English Test.

Proof of English Proficiency – Students must submit ONE of the following to prove English proficiency. TOEFL – Test of English as a Foreign Language – Minimum Score of 61 (IBT-Internet Based Test), 173 (CBT-Computer Based Test) or 500 (PBT-Paper Based Test). IELTS – International English Language Testing System – Minimum Score of 6.0. Duolingo – Online English Test – Minimum Score of 95. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109.

For international students, demonstration of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 61 or PBT 500, IELTS 6.0, Duolingo English Test 95, ELS Language Center Level 112, or Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic 44.
Program name: Middle School Education - English (Area of Emphasis)

EnglishScore: Proof of English Language Proficiency is required for all international students. This can be met by providing an official score from one of the following: TOEFL internet-based test (iBT), IELTS, ELS, or the Duolingo English Test.
Program name: Middle School Education - Math (Area of Emphasis)

EnglishScore: International students must provide proof of English proficiency by submitting one of the following: a minimum TOEFL score of 61 (iBT) or 500 (PBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum PTE score of 44, a minimum Duolingo score of 90, or successful completion of ELS Language Center Level 112. Other ways to meet the requirement include graduating from a secondary school where English is the language of instruction or earning a 'C' or better in a college-level English composition course at an accredited U.S. institution.
Program name: Middle School Education - Science (Area of Emphasis)

EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Options include a minimum TOEFL score of 61 (iBT) or 500 (PBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum Duolingo score of 95, a minimum PTE Academic score of 50, or completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Program name: Middle School Education - Social Studies (Area of Emphasis)

EnglishScore: Students must show evidence of English proficiency. This can be accomplished by submitting official TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or ELS Level 112 scores.

All international applicants whose native language is not English are required to provide proof of English proficiency by submitting ONE of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 61 on the Internet-based test (iBT). School code is 1464. IELTS: Minimum overall band score of 6.0. Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 90. ELS: Successful completion of ELS Level 112. PTE Academic: Minimum score of 50. Students who graduate from a high school in the United States or a country where English is the official language are exempt from this requirement.

Students from non-English speaking countries are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted scores include TOEFL iBT – 61, TOEFL PBT – 500, IELTS – 6.0, Duolingo – 90, PTE Academic – 44, or successful completion of level 112 in an ELS Language Center program.

Students must submit one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 61 on the IBT test or 500 on the paper-based test. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.0. Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 109. Successful completion of an approved ESL program. Transcripts from a high school where the primary language of instruction was English. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 44.

Proof of English Proficiency is required for students from non-English speaking countries. Acceptable tests and scores include: TOEFL with a minimum score of 61 on the IBT version or 500 on the paper-based version; IELTS with a minimum score of 5.5; Duolingo with a minimum score of 90; Completion of Level 109 of the English Language Services (ELS); or PTE with a score of 44. Students from English-speaking countries or who have graduated from a high school in the United States are exempt from this requirement.

If English is not your first language, you will need to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be done in one of the following ways: A minimum score of 61 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT) or 500 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT), A minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS, A minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test, Successful completion of ELS Level 112, A minimum score of 50 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE).

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to prove their English proficiency: TOEFL – minimum score of 61 (iBT), 173 (CBT), or 500 (PBT), IELTS – minimum score of 5.5, Duolingo – minimum score of 95, ELS – successful completion of ELS Level 109, Successful completion of an approved ESL program, SAT – minimum of 480 on the Evidence-Based Reading and Writing Section, ACT – minimum of 18 on the English Section, Transcript from a U.S. high school showing successful completion of two years of coursework with passing grades in English.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL – Test of English as a Foreign Language – score of 61 or higher on internet-based test (iBT), IELTS – International English Language Testing System – score of 6.0 or higher, Duolingo English Test - score of 90 or higher, ELS Level 112 Certificate of Completion, or Pearson PTE Academic score of 44.

All applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL – minimum score of 61 (IBT-Internet Based Test) or 500 (PBT-Paper Based Test), IELTS – minimum score of 6.0, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic – minimum score of 44, Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 90, or successful completion of a designated ESL program.

International students must submit an official score from one of the following testing agencies (test must be taken within two years of application): TOEFL iBT score of 61 or higher, IELTS score of 6.0 or higher, Duolingo score of 90 or higher, PTE (Pearson Test of English) score of 44 or higher, ACT English sub-score of 18 or higher, SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing score of 480 or higher, STEP Eiken Grade 2A or higher, or successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center. The requirement may be waived for students from countries where English is an official language or with proof of two years of study where English is the primary language of instruction.

Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: score of 61 or higher (iBT) or 500 or higher (paper-based), IELTS: score of 6.0 or higher, Duolingo English Test: score of 90 or higher, or successful completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) – 61 iBT or 500 PBT, IELTS (International English Language Testing System) – 6.0, Duolingo – 90, or ELS Language Center – Completion of Level 109.

Applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English proficiency. This can be accomplished by one of the following: A minimum score of 500 on the paper-based TOEFL, 173 on the computer-based, or 61 on the internet-based TOEFL. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109. A minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS. A minimum score of 85 on the Duolingo English Test. A minimum score of 44 on the PTE.

Proof of English proficiency is required for all applicants whose native language is not English. Any of the following will be accepted: TOEFL – 61 minimum iBT; 500 minimum PBT, IELTS – 5.5 minimum, PTE Academic – 44 minimum, Duolingo – 95 minimum, Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 109.
Proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL score of 61 (IBT), 500 (PBT), or IELTS score of 6.0.

All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a minimum score of 61 on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) internet-based test (iBT) or 500 on the paper-based test (PBT); a minimum score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 44 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 90 on Duolingo; or successful completion of ELS Level 112.

All international applicants must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official TOEFL or IELTS score report. Midway University requires a minimum score of 61 on the Internet-based TOEFL (iBT) or 5.5 on the IELTS. An ELS (English Language Services) Level 112 Certificate of Completion can be accepted in lieu of a TOEFL or IELTS score.

Students whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Students may meet this requirement by providing an official TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo score report. Scores must not be more than two years old.

Proof of English proficiency is required for all international applicants. Students can meet this requirement by submitting any ONE of the following: TOEFL score of 61 or higher (iBT), IELTS score of 6.0 or higher, Duolingo score of 90 or higher, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 44, ELS Language Center completion of Level 109, GaoKao English score of 90/150 or 60% of the total score, Successful completion of 24 credit hours at a regionally accredited U.S. college or university, Student is from an English-speaking country.

For international undergraduate students, proof of English Proficiency is required. Students can meet this by submitting one of the following: TOEFL minimum score of 61 on the iBT (internet based) or 500 on the paper-based exam; IELTS minimum score of 6.0; Duolingo English Test minimum score of 95; Successful completion of Level 112 of the ELS English Language program; Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) with a minimum score of 44.

Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be accomplished by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the Internet-based test (iBT), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL – Test of English as a Foreign Language – Minimum Score of 61 on the IBT test or 500 on the paper-based test; IELTS – International English Language Testing System – Minimum Score of 6.0; Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s level 112; Duolingo English Test – Minimum score of 90; GTEC (Global Test of English Communication) – Minimum score of 1075; Pearson PTE Academic – Minimum Score of 44.

All students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL- 61 IBT (Internet-based) or 500 PBT (Paper-based), IELTS- 6.0, Duolingo- 90, PTE- 50, or completion of ELS Level 112.

Non-native English speakers must provide proof of English proficiency by providing an official TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, or ELS Level 112 score report. This requirement is waived if the student has graduated from a U.S. high school, has successful completion of 24 credit hours from a U.S. college or university with a 2.0 GPA or higher.

All international students whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following official scores: TOEFL – 61 iBT or 500 PBT, IELTS – 6.0, Duolingo English Test – 90, PTE Academic – 44, or ELS Language Center – Level 109.

Proof of English proficiency is required for all international students. This can be met with one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) – minimum score of 61 on the iBT. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) – minimum score of 6.0. Duolingo English Test - minimum score of 90. Successful completion of ELS Level 112. Pearson Test of English (PTE) - minimum score of 50.

International students must submit ONE of the following: TOEFL – required score of 61 on the IBT (internet-based test) or 500 on the paper-based test, IELTS – required score of 6.0, Duolingo – score of 95, ELS Language Center – Completion of Level 112, or PTE - Pearson Test of English Academic - required score of 44.

Students must submit ONE of the following to show English proficiency: TOEFL – Test of English as a Foreign Language – Minimum score of 61 on the Internet Based Test (iBT) or 500 on the paper-based test (PBT). Midway University’s TOEFL code is 1467. IELTS – International English Language Testing System – Minimum score of 6.0. Duolingo English Test – Minimum score of 90. ELS Language Centers – Successful completion of level 112. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic – Minimum score of 44.

All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL – Test of English as a Foreign Language minimum score of 61 (IBT) or 500 (PBT), IELTS – International English Language Testing System minimum score of 6.0, PTE – Pearson Test of English Academic minimum score of 44, Duolingo – Minimum score of 95, Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s level 112, Successful completion of an approved ESL program, Graduation from a secondary school in which English is the language of instruction, or Successful completion of English Comp I & II at a U.S. college/university with a grade of ‘C’ or better.

For international students who are not native English speakers, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL 61 (iBT) or 500 (PBT), IELTS 6.0, PTE 50, Duolingo English Test 90, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112. Waivers may be available for students who meet certain criteria, such as previous education in the United States.

All international students must provide proof of English language proficiency. A minimum score of 61 on the TOEFL IBT (or 500 on the PBT), a 6.0 on the IELTS, a 90 on the Duolingo English Test, or successful completion of ELS Level 112 is required. An applicant is exempt if they have successfully completed a college-level English Composition course from an accredited U.S. institution with a C grade or better OR if English is the native language of the applicant’s country of origin.

Students from countries where the primary language is not English are required to take either the TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) or IELTS (International English Language Testing System) exam. The minimum acceptable score on the TOEFL is 70 on the internet-based test (iBT). The minimum acceptable score on the IELTS is 6.0.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following as proof of English proficiency: TOEFL – a minimum score of 61 on the IBT (internet based test) or 500 on the PBT (paper based test), IELTS – a minimum score of 5.5, Duolingo – a minimum score of 95, ELS Level 112 Certificate of Completion, Successful completion of 24 credit hours from a U.S. college or university, Successful completion of English as a Second language from a partner school.

If English is not the primary language spoken in your home country, you must provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following methods: TOEFL score of 61 or higher (iBT), IELTS score of 6.0 or higher, Duolingo English Test score of 90 or higher, ELS Language Center completion of Level 112, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 44 or higher, Successful completion of 24 credit hours from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university with a grade point average of 2.0 or higher.

Students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. Students may meet this requirement in any one of the following ways: TOEFL – minimum score of 61 (iBT), IELTS – minimum score of 6.0, Duolingo – minimum score of 90, ELS Language Center – completion of level 109, Pearson (PTE Academic) – minimum score of 44, Successful completion of 24 credit hours from a U.S. college or university.

Students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English Proficiency through one of the following: TOEFL (minimum 61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), Duolingo English Test (minimum 90), ELS Language Centers (completion of ELS Level 109), or Pearson (PTE) Academic (minimum 44).

Students must submit one of the following to show English proficiency: TOEFL – 61 or higher on iBT or 500 or higher on paper-based test; IELTS – 5.5 or higher overall band score; Duolingo – 85 or higher; Successful completion of ELS Language Center Level 109; or PTE Academic – 44. A student may be exempt from this if they are from an English speaking country or have completed college-level English.

Students from non-English speaking countries are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Midway University accepts the following: TOEFL – Minimum score of 61 on the IBT test or 500 on the paper-based test; IELTS – Minimum score of 6.0; PTE Academic – Minimum score of 44; Duolingo – Minimum score of 90; Successful completion of ELS Language Center’s level 109; SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing Section Score of 480 or ACT English Section Score of 18.

For non-native English speakers, evidence of English proficiency is required by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 61 on the iBT or 500 on the PBT; IELTS with a minimum score of 6.0; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90; ELS completion of Level 112; SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing score of 480 or higher or ACT English score of 18 or higher; Successful completion of 24 credit hours from a U.S. college or university with a 2.0 GPA; or a transcript from a secondary school in a native English-speaking country with at least two years of attendance.
